title: Solution to 820-3332 A1398 Macbook Pro GPU/freezing problem
message:
So I've got 2 of these 820-3332 machines that do the exact same thing. both of them run great until you try to play a video in full screen, then they shut down. When booted back up i get the error report that says GPU Panic error. i ran ASD EFI and it passed. When i run ASD O.S. it fails for IC0R.

almost seems like another issue like in the 2010 15" machines with the shit capacitor.

has anyone known this to be a common issue with this board?

title: Solution to 820-3332 A1398 Macbook Pro GPU/freezing problem
message: Yeah, a common issue covered by an Apple replacement program. Plug them into a good casing assembly and get them replaced for free. GPU failure.

title: Solution to 820-3332 A1398 Macbook Pro GPU/freezing problem
message:
Resolder U8900, don't pull them pre heat the board and drag your iron around the pins with some fresh solder.

The Apple program ended 2 months ago........

title: Solution to 820-3332 A1398 Macbook Pro GPU/freezing problem
message: A large majority of the 3332 boards are still covered (4 years from original date of purchase). I've had 2 repaired in the past month. They will have the original date of purchase on file, but you're right, a lot of them will not be covered any longer.

title: Solution to 820-3332 A1398 Macbook Pro GPU/freezing problem
message: Resoldering U8900 is a quicker way for me. It really is the only issue with these boards, GPU has nothing wrong with it.

title: Solution to 820-3332 A1398 Macbook Pro GPU/freezing problem
message: That's good to know, and a great help. Thanks, duke--as always!

title: Solution to 820-3332 A1398 Macbook Pro GPU/freezing problem
message: You found it here, world first. Not seen anyone figured out U8900 yet. Done 3 this week so far, another gold mine like 2850 boards.

title: Solution to 820-3332 A1398 Macbook Pro GPU/freezing problem
message: That's good to know; I can save time sending people to Apple to check on their coverage, and then having them come back for OOW repair. Thanks, duke.

title: Solution to 820-3332 A1398 Macbook Pro GPU/freezing problem
message: It's just better in any case to just fix the original board. The refurb garbage boards that Apple is using you never know what you going to get.
